input: Anne is cold. Anne is white. Dave is round. Erin is cold. Erin is kind. Fiona is cold. Fiona is furry. If something is kind and round then it is quiet. If something is white and round then it is kind. If Erin is cold then Erin is white. If Dave is quiet then Dave is cold. If something is round then it is smart. Smart things are white. All quiet things are furry. If Anne is quiet then Anne is smart. Question: Dave is cold.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Fiona : obj

constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Cold Anne
axiom T2 : White Anne
axiom T3 : Round Dave
axiom T4 : Cold Erin
axiom T5 : Kind Erin
axiom T6 : Cold Fiona
axiom T7 : Furry Fiona

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Round x → Quiet x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Round x → Kind x
axiom R3 : Cold Erin → White Erin
axiom R4 : Quiet Dave → Cold Dave
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Round x → Smart x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → White x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Quiet x → Furry x
axiom R8 : Quiet Anne → Smart Anne

theorem dave_is_cold : Cold Dave :=
begin
  apply R4,
  apply R1,
  split,
  apply R2,
  split,
  apply R6,
  apply R5,
  exact T3,
  exact T3,
end

-- The answer is True
